content:
I can provide you with a general comparison of prices for organic layer feed at the retailers I mentioned earlier. Please note that prices may vary depending on the specific product, size, and location. I'll do my best to provide a general idea of what you can expect.

**Amazon**

* Organic layer feed prices: $15 - $30 per 20-pound bag (approximately $0.75 - $1.50 per pound)
* Brands: Purina, Manna Pro, Kalmbach Feeds, and more
* Promotions: Amazon often offers free shipping on orders over $25, and you can also take advantage of Subscribe & Save discounts (up to 15% off).
* Current deals: Check Amazon's pet food section for current promotions and discounts.

**Chewy.com**

* Organic layer feed prices: $18 - $35 per 20-pound bag (approximately $0.90 - $1.75 per pound)
* Brands: Purina, Manna Pro, Blue Buffalo, and more
* Promotions: Chewy.com offers free shipping on orders over $49, and you can also get 5% off your first Autoship order.
* Current deals: Check Chewy.com's website for current promotions and discounts.

**Tractor Supply Co.**

* Organic layer feed prices: $20 - $40 per 20-pound bag (approximately $1.00 - $2.00 per pound)
* Brands: Tractor Supply Co.'s own brand, as well as Purina and Manna Pro
* Promotions: Tractor Supply Co. often offers sales and discounts on their website and in-store. They also have a loyalty program that rewards customers with points for every purchase.
* Current deals: Check Tractor Supply Co.'s website for current promotions and discounts.

**Local Feed Stores or Co-ops**

* Organic layer feed prices: Prices can vary widely depending on the location, brand, and quality of the feed.
* Brands: Local brands, as well as national brands like Purina and Manna Pro
* Promotions: Local feed stores or co-ops may offer discounts for bulk purchases, loyalty programs, or other promotions.
* Current deals: It's best to contact your local feed store or co-op directly to inquire about current promotions and discounts.

Keep in mind that prices may vary depending on your location and the specific product you choose. I recommend checking the retailers' websites or visiting your local feed store or co-op to get the most up-to-date pricing and promotional information.

Remember to also consider factors like shipping costs, customer service, and product quality when making your decision.
